text: I know that critics say that giving the
Winter Olympics for Beijing is a bad
idea bitching they see it as rewarding
and legitimizing a brutal and a
repressive government in the midst of a
crackdown it's certainly true that after
2008 Beijing didn't emerge as the more
democratic country we might like to see
but it's also true that giving the
winter olympics in beijing creates a
force for greater accountability for
supporting civil society look as a young
foreign correspondent I covered South
Korea back in the 1980s and I saw
firsthand the way the 1988 Seoul
Olympics help bring democracy to South
Korea and that ushered in free elections
and the democracy that we have in South
Korea today I can't say the same is
going to happen in China but on balance
it seems to me this can be a positive
for human rights in China
Oh
